address: Chernecha Hora St, 1, L'viv, L'vivs'ka oblast, Ukraine, 79000

reviews.text: I love this partially wild park. Whenever I go off the main road, I always end up somewhere I wasn't before last time. Recommend for picnics, hiking or just going for a walk for cute pictures. Somewhere in the middle of the park there is an installation of an old Ukrainian village, also worthy to check (the entry is not free though)

Great place to go to see the way things used to be! The whole family will have fun here and you could easily spend several hours. Be sure to wear good shoes because some of the paths can be muddy if it has rained. Some paths go into the woods and can get pretty steep.

Must see place when visiting Lviv.  Brilliant architecture displaying various old traditional Ukrainian and Polish buildings. Excellent place for families and individuals alike to visit. Entrance fee was 40UAH for adults and 20UAH for children. There is so much to see here. Cafe sells tasty grilled meat too.
A must see cultural exchange which can be reached on foot 40 minutes from centre or about 4 bus stops plus 18 minutes walk.
Pick a dry day if you can.

Beautiful park with huts that inform you of Ukrainian heritage and art. There is a pond with swans in addition to some animals. At the other end there is a small cafe and some traditional games.
Loved it and took many photos.

Beautiful space full of greenery and animals captive including_ horses, sheeps, goats, eagle, turkey, swan,etc
It's a huge green area with many ancient houses kept for observation
The ticket costs 50hrv
You need atleast 2 hours to see through it completely
But be aware it closes at 6 PM
Besides it's a good place for one time visit only and with a group otherwise you may get boredðŸ˜…
